direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods manipulate the class attribute of elements, with toggleClass adding the class if it is not present and removing it if it is.
Both methods manipulate the class attribute of elements, with toggleClass removing the class if it is present and adding it if it is not.
The hasClass method is used to determine if a class is present, which is a prerequisite for toggleClass to decide whether to add or remove the class.
Both methods modify attributes of elements, although attr is more general and can modify any attribute, not just the class attribute.
Both methods modify attributes of elements, with removeAttr specifically removing an attribute, similar to how toggleClass removes a class if it is present.
The select method is used to filter elements based on a query, which can be used to target specific elements for class toggling.
The parse method from the QueryParser class is used to parse selector queries, which can be used to target specific elements for class toggling.
